alert.note: Alert for Delta (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 21 at 3:38PM MDT until May 24 at 2:45PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR SNOWMELT IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Hydrologic flooding caused by snowmelt is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of west central Colorado, including the following county, Delta. * WHEN...Until 600 PM MDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 334 PM MDT, emergency management reported flooding in the advisory area, mainly in the form of significant erosion of banks along the river. - This includes the following streams and drainages... North Fork Gunnison River, Cottonwood Creek, Jay Creek, Leroux Creek and Bell Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... remote areas near Hotchkiss. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
